text: ポポルさん、魔王の城の鍵の情報は何かわかりましたか?
translation: Popola, have you found any information about the keys to the Shadowlord's castle?
grammar: ～か is a question particle; ～ましたか is polite past question form

text: そうそう、ちょうどそのことで話したいことがあったの
translation: Yes, actually I had something I wanted to talk about regarding that.
grammar: ～たいことがある expresses having something one wants to do; ～の at the end is feminine sentence-ending particle

text: 崖の村はわかるわよね? / ああ、あの憂鬱な者どもの陰気な村か
translation: You know the Aerie, right? / Ah, that gloomy village of melancholic people?
grammar: ～わよね is feminine confirmation-seeking; 者ども uses contemptuous plural suffix ども (Weiss's archaic/dismissive speech)

text: それが最近はそうでもないらしいわ
translation: It seems that's not the case lately.
grammar: ～らしい indicates hearsay or conjecture (it seems); ～わ is feminine sentence-ending particle

text: 崖の村の村長からの手紙よ
translation: This is a letter from the mayor of the Aerie.
grammar: ～からの indicates origin/source (from); ～よ is feminine assertive sentence-ending particle

text: にえ
translation: Sacrifice...

text: 魔王の城の鍵の名前が / そうね
translation: The name of the key to the Shadowlord's castle... / Yes.
grammar: Sentence trails off with が, indicating surprise or continuation; そうね is feminine agreement

text: 各村の村長に問い合わせてみたの
translation: I asked the mayors of various villages.

vocabulary.meaning: to inquire, to make an inquiry

grammar: ～てみる means to try doing something; ～の is feminine explanatory sentence-ender

text: すごいさすがポポロさん / しかしなんだか都合が良すぎはしないか
translation: Amazing, as expected of Popola. / But doesn't this seem a bit too convenient?

vocabulary.meaning: as expected, as one would expect

grammar: ～すぎる means too much; ～はしないか is a rhetorical question suggesting doubt (Weiss's formal speech pattern)

text: ええ
translation: Yes...

text: どういうこと
translation: What do you mean?

vocabulary.meaning: what kind of, what sort of

grammar: どういうこと is an idiomatic expression meaning 'what do you mean?' or 'what's going on?'

text: あれだけ閉鎖的だった村人が商売を始めた
translation: Those villagers who were so isolated have started doing business.
grammar: あれだけ～だった emphasizes the degree of the past state; を始めた indicates starting a new action

text: その上魔王の城の鍵の情報まで教えると
translation: And on top of that, they're willing to share information about the Shadowlord's castle key.

vocabulary.meaning: moreover, on top of that, furthermore
to teach, to tell, to inform

grammar: ～まで means 'even' (emphasizing extent beyond expectation); ～と at the end quotes or introduces reported speech

text: ちょっと危険な感じがするわね
translation: It feels a bit dangerous.
grammar: ～感じがする means 'to feel like' or 'to have a sense that'; ～わね is feminine agreement-seeking

text: 気にしすぎさ / それに危険でも構わない
translation: You're worrying too much. / Besides, I don't care if it's dangerous.
grammar: ～すぎ means 'too much'; ～でも構わない means 'it doesn't matter even if'; さ is masculine casual sentence-ender

text: 待っているだけじゃヨナは戻っては来ない
translation: Just waiting won't bring Yonah back.
grammar: ～ているだけじゃ means 'just doing... won't'; 戻っては来ない emphasizes the negative result (won't come back)

text: それに魔物がいたら皆殺しにすればいいだけだ
translation: Besides, if there are monsters, we just have to kill them all.

vocabulary.meaning: if there are (conditional of いる)

grammar: ～たら is conditional 'if'; ～にすればいい means 'we should just'; だけだ emphasizes simplicity

text: そう、わかったわ / 気をつけてね
translation: I see. I understand. / Be careful.

vocabulary.meaning: to be careful, to take care

grammar: ～わ is feminine sentence-ender; 気をつけて is the te-form used as a gentle imperative

text: まずは村長の家を訪ねてみるといいわ
translation: You should try visiting the mayor's house first.

vocabulary.meaning: first of all, to begin with

grammar: ～てみるといい means 'you should try doing'; combines trying (てみる) with suggestion (といい)

text: 私たちは望まない
translation: We do not wish...

vocabulary.meaning: to wish, to desire, to hope for

grammar: ～ない is negative form; sentence trails off dramatically

text: 不要な戦いを望まない
translation: We do not wish for unnecessary fighting.
grammar: 不要な is na-adjective modifying 戦い; を望まない means 'do not desire'

text: このまま共存することができるのなら
translation: If we could continue to coexist like this...

vocabulary.meaning: can do, to be able to

grammar: ～することができる is a formal way to say 'can do'; ～のなら is conditional 'if it is that'

text: このまま穏やかに暮らし続けられるだろう
translation: We could continue living peacefully like this.

vocabulary.meaning: to live, to make a living

grammar: ～続けられる is potential form of 続ける (can continue); だろう expresses probability or supposition

text: だがあの男がやってくる
translation: But that man is coming.
grammar: やってくる emphasizes approaching/arriving; だが is more formal/literary than でも

text: そうだあの男がやってくる / 女も子供もみなおろしになる
translation: Yes, that man is coming. / Women and children alike will be slaughtered.
grammar: ～も～も means 'both... and...'; みなおろし is a variant pronunciation/transcription of 皆殺し

text: どうすれば一体どうすればいいのだ
translation: What should we do? What on earth should we do?

vocabulary.meaning: what on earth, what in the world

grammar: どうすればいい is 'what should one do'; 一体 adds emphasis/desperation; のだ adds explanatory/emotional tone

text: 俺たちポポルさんの村から来ました
translation: We came from Popola's village.
grammar: ～から来ました is standard self-introduction pattern meaning 'came from'

text: もうダメだ / 手紙の件についてお話を聞きたいんです / もう、この裏はお絞りだ
translation: It's all over... / I want to talk to you about the letter. / It's all over for this village...
grammar: ～について means 'about/concerning'; ～たいんです is polite form of wanting to do something

text: ふん、こういう陰気な輩であったな
translation: Hmph, such gloomy people they are.
grammar: であったな is Weiss's archaic past copula (modern: だったな); 輩 is dismissive term for people

text: 村長、だってあなたが手紙を出してくれたんですよね?
translation: Mayor, didn't you send us the letter?

vocabulary.meaning: to send, to put out, to submit

grammar: ～てくれた indicates someone did something for the speaker's benefit; ～んですよね seeks confirmation

text: 知らない、手紙など知らない
translation: I don't know. I don't know anything about a letter.
grammar: ～など is dismissive, meaning 'such things as' with negative nuance; repetition shows desperation

text: どういうことだ? / 他の者に聞いてみた方が早そうだな
translation: What's going on? / It might be faster to ask someone else.
grammar: ～た方が早い means 'it's faster to'; ～そうだ expresses appearance/likelihood

text: 村の者に聞き込みをしてみよう
translation: Let's try asking the villagers.
grammar: ～をしてみよう is volitional form meaning 'let's try doing'; 聞き込み is a compound noun for investigative questioning

text: 手紙か聞いたことあるような
translation: A letter? I feel like I've heard about it...
grammar: ～たことある means 'have experienced/done before'; ～ような trails off suggesting uncertainty

text: 知ってるのか / ないような
translation: Do you know? / Or maybe not...
grammar: ～のか is questioning; ないような trails off with uncertainty

text: どっちなのだ / ところであんたはカイネさんの友達かい
translation: Which is it? / By the way, are you a friend of Kaine?
grammar: なのだ is Weiss's archaic emphatic (modern: なんだ); かい is casual masculine question particle

text: そうだな / 噂には聞いてるよ
translation: Yeah. / I've heard the rumors.
grammar: ～には聞いている means 'have heard about (something specific)'

text: 魔物狩りをしているんだって
translation: I hear you're hunting monsters.
grammar: ～んだって is casual hearsay form meaning 'I hear that'; 魔物狩り is a compound noun

text: しかにこの村の魔物も全滅できるものならしておきたいところだが
translation: If we could, we'd like to wipe out the monsters in this village too.
grammar: ～ものなら means 'if one could'; ～ておきたい means 'would like to do in advance'; ～ところだが indicates incomplete desire

text: そうか、全滅か。全滅、全滅、全滅、全滅。
translation: I see... annihilation... Annihilation, annihilation, annihilation, annihilation...
grammar: Repetition shows mental breakdown/obsession; か at end is reflective

text: シロ! / 分かっておる。魔物だ。
translation: Weiss! / I know. It's a monster.
grammar: 分かっておる is Weiss's archaic continuous form (modern: 分かっている); おる is archaic form of いる

text: くそ、罠か? / 見ろ。 / 帰りが遅いから、迎えに来たぞ!
translation: Damn, a trap? / Look! / You were taking too long, so I came to get you!
grammar: 見ろ is imperative of 見る; 迎えに来た means 'came to pick up/meet'; ぞ is masculine emphatic particle

text: すまない。祭りになってしまったもんでな。
translation: Sorry. It's turned into quite a party here.
grammar: ～てしまった indicates regrettable completion; もんで is casual explanatory (from ものだから); な is sentence-ending agreement

text: 私も参加させてもらおう / 殺人祭りだな
translation: Let me join in. / A murder festival, huh.
grammar: ～させてもらう is humble form meaning 'to be allowed to do'; 殺人祭り is darkly ironic compound

text: アンゲさんの村の人たち / パモノリに乗っ取られても
translation: The people of this Aerie village... / Even if they've been taken over by Shades...

vocabulary.meaning: to take over, to hijack, to possess

grammar: ～ても means 'even if'; sentence trails off showing hesitation

text: でも全員じゃない / 人間も混じってる
translation: But not all of them. / Humans are mixed in too.
grammar: じゃない is negative copula; ～てる is casual continuous form (混じっている)

text: 逃げるんだ
translation: Run!

vocabulary.meaning: to run away, to escape, to flee

grammar: ～んだ adds urgency/command; functions as emphatic imperative

text: 嫌だよ / 姉さんを追いで逃げられるわけないじゃないか
translation: No! / There's no way I can run and leave my sister behind!
grammar: ～わけない means 'there's no way that'; じゃないか adds emotional emphasis

text: カイリーそいつら / 女の方は魔物だ / 騙されるな
translation: Kaine, those... / The woman is a monster! / Don't be fooled!

vocabulary.meaning: to deceive, to fool, to trick

grammar: 騙されるな is negative imperative of passive (don't be deceived); ～の方 indicates 'the... one'

text: 姉さん
translation: Sister...

text: 姉さん
translation: Sister!

text: お前たちこそ化け物じゃないのか
translation: Aren't you the real monsters?!
grammar: こそ emphasizes the preceding word strongly; ～じゃないのか is rhetorical accusation

text: お前の姉さんはもう魔物になってるんだぞ / 魔物だろうが何だろうが
translation: Your sister is already a monster! / Monster or not...
grammar: ～んだぞ is emphatic masculine assertion; ～だろうが何だろうが means 'whether... or whatever'

text: 僕の / 僕の優しい姉さんだ
translation: She's my... / She's my kind sister!
grammar: Repetition shows emotional emphasis; だ is assertive copula

text: 帰れ
translation: Go away!

vocabulary.meaning: to go back, to return, to leave

grammar: 帰れ is imperative form of 帰る; harsh command

text: やめろ!やめろ!セーサーを傷つけるか!
translation: Stop! Stop! Don't hurt my sister!

vocabulary.meaning: to hurt, to wound, to injure

grammar: やめろ is imperative of やめる; ～を傷つけるか is rhetorical outrage (how dare you hurt)

text: なんだこれは?これでは我らの方が…
translation: What is this? At this rate, we're the...
grammar: 我ら is Weiss's archaic first-person plural (modern: 私たち); ～の方が trails off implying 'we are the (bad) ones'

text: あちらで村人が襲われておるぞ
translation: Villagers are being attacked over there!
grammar: 襲われておる is Weiss's archaic passive continuous (modern: 襲われている); おる replaces いる

text: カイネ起きてくれ目を覚ませ / エミールカイネを頼んだ
translation: Kaine, wake up! Open your eyes! / Emil, I'm counting on you with Kaine!

vocabulary.meaning: to wake up, to get up
to wake up, to open one's eyes
to request, to entrust, to rely on

grammar: ～てくれ is masculine request; 目を覚ませ is imperative; 頼んだ is past tense used for firm request

text: 俺はあっちを片付ける / わかりました
translation: I'll take care of things over there. / Understood!

vocabulary.meaning: to clean up, to take care of, to deal with

grammar: 片付ける used idiomatically means 'to deal with/handle (enemies)'

text: あれは
translation: That's...

text: あれもあんなのまで守るだというのか
translation: Do they really intend to protect even that?
grammar: ～まで means 'even'; ～というのか expresses disbelief/rhetorical question

text: 村人たちが巻き込まれたんだ
translation: The villagers got caught up in this.

vocabulary.meaning: to involve, to drag into, to get caught up in

grammar: 巻き込まれた is passive of 巻き込む; んだ adds explanation

text: いやいやです / このままじゃ僕たち村のみんなを
translation: No, no! / At this rate, we'll... everyone in the village...
grammar: このままじゃ means 'if things continue like this'; sentence trails off in despair

text: そんなの嫌だ
translation: I don't want that!
grammar: そんなの嫌だ is emotional rejection; だ makes it definitive

text: お疲れ様でした
translation: (Transcription error - YouTube video artifact)

text: お疲れ様でした
translation: (Transcription error - YouTube video artifact)

text: 今だ / 奴の中心に魔力を集中させよ
translation: Now! / Concentrate your magic at its center!
grammar: させよ is Weiss's archaic imperative of させる (modern: させろ); archaic command form

text: なんという素早さだ
translation: What incredible speed!
grammar: なんという～だ is exclamatory pattern expressing amazement

text: 危ない / 何か / 行きます
translation: Watch out! / What? / I'm going!
grammar: 危ない as exclamation means 'watch out!'; 行きます is polite volitional

text: 逆転が裏に集まっておるぞ / 高い場所から攻撃せよ
translation: They're gathering behind! / Attack from a high place!
grammar: 集まっておる is Weiss's archaic continuous; 攻撃せよ is archaic imperative (modern: 攻撃しろ)

text: 僕がこいつを区切手にします / エミール
translation: I'll hold this one off! / Emil!

vocabulary.meaning: to hold off, to check, to stop

grammar: 食い止めにします means 'I will hold off'; にします indicates intention

text: エミール / ここは僕が食い止めます / 今ならあいつを後ろから狙うことができるはずです
translation: Emil! / I'll hold them off here! / You should be able to target it from behind now!
grammar: ～ことができるはずです means 'should be able to do'; はず indicates expectation

text: 回り込んで倒してください
translation: Please go around and defeat it!

vocabulary.meaning: to go around, to flank, to get behind

grammar: ～て＋～てください chains actions; polite request

text: お願いします / ここはエミールに任せて
translation: Please! / Leave this to Emil!
grammar: ～に任せて means 'leave it to (someone)'; て-form as soft command

text: 奴の後ろに回り込むぞ
translation: Let's get behind it!
grammar: ～ぞ is masculine emphatic/volitional particle

text: 慎重に奴の目を狙え
translation: Carefully aim for its eye!
grammar: 慎重に is adverbial form; 狙え is imperative of 狙う

text: ま、まだですか
translation: I-Is it not done yet?
grammar: Stuttering ま shows strain/fear; まだですか is polite question 'not yet?'

text: やった / 奴は奥に逃げたぞ
translation: We did it! / It fled deeper inside!
grammar: やった is past of やる used as exclamation of success; ぞ is emphatic

text: 少し休んだらそちらに向かいます / わかった、エミイル、あまり無理をするな
translation: I'll head your way after resting a bit. / Got it. Emil, don't push yourself too hard.

vocabulary.meaning: to overdo it, to push oneself

grammar: ～たら indicates 'after doing'; 無理をするな is prohibition (don't overdo it)

text: くそ、あれだけの攻撃でまだ動けるのか
translation: Damn, it can still move after all those attacks?
grammar: あれだけの～で means 'with/after that much'; のか expresses disbelief

text: 合体した奴の生命力は侮れるということだ
translation: The life force of that combined creature cannot be underestimated.

vocabulary.meaning: to look down on, to underestimate

grammar: 侮れぬ would be Weiss's archaic negative potential (cannot be underestimated); ということだ concludes explanation

text: 僕と一緒に、あいつに力をつけてください! / はい! / 分かった
translation: Together with me, lend your power against it! / Yes! / Got it!
grammar: ～と一緒に means 'together with'; ～てください is polite request

text: おやめろエミール
translation: Hey, stop! Emil!
grammar: お＋やめろ adds urgency to the imperative; shows concern

text: エミール / いなエミールはおらぬ
translation: Emil! / No... Emil is not here.
grammar: おらぬ is Weiss's archaic negative of おる (modern: いない); いな is archaic 'no'

text: ここにあるは最強兵地の本能のみ
translation: All that remains here is the instinct of the ultimate weapon.
grammar: あるは is archaic topic marker (modern: あるのは); のみ is literary 'only' (modern: だけ)

text: おいやばいぞカイゲー
translation: Hey, this is bad! Kaine!
grammar: やばいぞ uses emphatic ぞ; urgent warning

text: Продолжение следует...
translation: (Transcription error - Russian 'To be continued...')

text: ごめんなさい。僕も、僕のせいで、罪のない人まで。
translation: I'm sorry. Because of me... even innocent people...
grammar: ～のせいで means 'because of (someone's fault)'; ～まで means 'even' (extending blame)

text: けど、エミールは俺たちを救ってくれたじゃないか。
translation: But Emil, you saved us, didn't you?
grammar: ～てくれた indicates someone did something beneficial for the speaker; じゃないか seeks agreement

text: エミールがいなければ、俺たちは死んでたよ。ありがとう。
translation: If you weren't here, we would have died. Thank you.
grammar: ～なければ～ていた is counterfactual conditional 'if not..., would have'

text: でも、でも、僕。
translation: But, but I...
grammar: Repetition shows emotional struggle; sentence trails off

text: いいんだ。
translation: It's okay.
grammar: いいんだ is reassuring expression meaning 'it's okay/fine'

text: もう振り向くな
translation: Don't look back anymore.

vocabulary.meaning: to turn around, to look back

grammar: ～な is prohibition (don't); directive not to dwell on the past

text: とにかくこの村からは出よう
translation: Anyway, let's get out of this village.
grammar: 出よう is volitional form of 出る meaning 'let's leave'

text: そうだな
translation: Yeah.
grammar: Masculine agreement expression

text: ほぉ?あの小僧…いや、王が結婚とは…世の中分からぬものだ。
translation: Oh? That kid... no, the King is getting married? The world is full of surprises.
grammar: ～とは expresses surprise; 分からぬ is Weiss's archaic negative (modern: 分からない); ものだ concludes reflection

text: 結婚式か。ぜひとも行ってお祝いしなくちゃいけないな。さっそく王のところに行こう。
translation: A wedding? We definitely have to go celebrate. Let's go to the King right away.
grammar: ～なくちゃいけない means 'have to'; 行こう is volitional 'let's go'

text: 次回予告
translation: (Transcription error - 'Next episode preview')

text: もしかしてフィア
translation: Could it be... Fyra?
grammar: もしかして introduces uncertain recognition

text: 驚いたな / すっかり大人っぽくなりよって
translation: I'm surprised. / You've become quite grown-up.
grammar: なりよって is Weiss's archaic form of なって (became); よって is archaic auxiliary

text: そういうことならカイにも呼ばないとな
translation: If that's the case, we need to invite Kaine too.
grammar: ～なら is conditional 'if'; ～ないとな means 'have to' with masculine な

text: な
translation: Right?
grammar: な is agreement-seeking particle

text: つい、いらそうとさったら銀と損機師って大釣りだったらけ
translation: (Facade language - fictional language in the game)
grammar: Facade is an invented language used by the masked people in NieR

text: あ、見えるさい
translation: (Facade language)

text: はじめまして / この度のご結婚おめでとうございます
translation: Nice to meet you. / Congratulations on your marriage.

vocabulary.word: おめでとうございます
vocabulary.reading: おめでとうございます

grammar: ご～ is honorific prefix; ～おめでとうございます is formal congratulations

text: たく
translation: (Facade language)

text: あの、かいねさんなんですけど
translation: Um, about Kaine...
grammar: ～なんですけど is hedging expression meaning 'about... (there's something)'

text: 結婚ってくるなろ / 一緒にさわたいてとち
translation: (Facade language)

text: あたちやた
translation: (Facade language)

text: 許せれやりさたちとき手すれ
translation: (Facade language)

text: ああそうさせてもらうよ
translation: Ah, we'll do that.
grammar: ～させてもらう is humble/receiving permission form meaning 'to be allowed to'

text: 今は騎士ゼルガンド / 改ざん草
translation: (Facade language - Knight Zelgand...)

text: かけるわせち / された
translation: (Facade language)

text: やれやれ
translation: Good grief.

vocabulary.meaning: good grief, dear me, what a relief

grammar: Interjection expressing exasperation or relief

text: 風呂に入る時まで掟があるとは / シロは浮かんでただけじゃないか
translation: There are rules even for taking a bath? / Weiss was just floating!
grammar: ～時まで means 'even when'; ～とは expresses surprise; ～てただけ is casual 'was just doing'

text: カイネ / どうした
translation: Kaine. / What's wrong?
grammar: どうした is casual 'what's wrong/what happened'

text: 結婚式などというめでたい席に / 私が出てもいいのか
translation: At such a celebratory occasion as a wedding... / Is it okay for me to attend?
grammar: ～などという means 'such as'; ～てもいいのか asks permission with uncertainty

text: いいんだよ / 王が直々に招待してくれたんだから
translation: It's fine. / The King personally invited us.
grammar: いいんだよ is reassuring; ～てくれた indicates favor received; んだから gives reason

text: 王は良くても周りの人間が / この街は俺やカイネの村とは違う
translation: Even if the King is fine with it, the people around... / This city is different from your village or mine.
grammar: ～ても means 'even if'; ～とは違う means 'is different from'

text: 掟が全てなんだ
translation: Rules are everything here.
grammar: ～なんだ is explanatory emphasis

text: 変な話だけど掟に書かれていないことは誰も気にしない
translation: It's strange, but no one cares about things that aren't in the rules.
grammar: 変な話だけど is set phrase 'it's a strange thing but'; 誰も～ない is 'no one'

text: そうか、なら / 我個人の価値観からすれば
translation: I see, then... / From my personal values...
grammar: 我 is Weiss's archaic first-person pronoun; ～からすれば means 'from the perspective of'

text: かような下着姿で婚礼の場に臨むは
translation: Appearing at a wedding venue in such underwear...

vocabulary.meaning: to attend, to face, to be present at

grammar: かような is Weiss's archaic 'such' (modern: このような); 臨むは uses archaic topic marker (modern: 臨むのは)

text: はなはだ奇妙に映るがな
translation: Seems quite strange to me.

vocabulary.meaning: to appear, to seem, to be reflected

grammar: はなはだ is literary/archaic intensifier; ～に映る means 'appears as'; がな is Weiss's archaic concessive ending

text: ふん
translation: Hmph.

text: どうした?
translation: What's wrong?

text: いや、なんだか寝られなくて / 何か心配事でもあるのか?
translation: No, I just couldn't sleep. / Is something worrying you?
grammar: 寝られなくて uses potential negative with て indicating reason; ～でもあるのか asks 'is there perhaps'

text: 全然そんなんじゃないです / 明日の結婚式が楽しみで / いろいろ想像してたら目が冴えてきちゃって
translation: No, it's nothing like that! / I'm excited about tomorrow's wedding. / I was imagining things and couldn't sleep.

vocabulary.meaning: to be wide awake, can't sleep

grammar: 目が冴える is idiom for 'becoming too alert to sleep'; ～てきちゃって is casual regrettable change

text: 素敵だろうなきれいだろうな
translation: It'll be wonderful... It'll be beautiful...
grammar: ～だろうな expresses wistful speculation/imagination

text: いいなフィアさんいいな
translation: I'm so envious of Fyra...
grammar: いいな expresses envy; repetition emphasizes longing

text: エミールにもいつかいいお嫁さんが見つかるよ
translation: Emil, you'll find a good bride someday too.
grammar: ～にも means 'for you too'; 見つかる is intransitive 'will be found'

text: お嫁さん?
translation: Bride?
grammar: Question mark indicates surprise/confusion at the assumption

text: ああお嫁さんですか / 他に何がある / 寝ぼけておるのか / さっさと寝ろ
translation: Oh, a bride... / What else could there be? / Are you half asleep? / Hurry up and sleep!
grammar: 寝ぼけておるのか is Weiss's archaic (modern: 寝ぼけているのか); さっさと寝ろ is blunt command

text: そうじゃないんだけどな
translation: That's not what I meant...
grammar: ～んだけどな shows frustrated explanation with trailing regret; implies unspoken meaning

text: リュウテイタイ 終えた
translation: (Facade language)

text: ゼルガンと 救世し続いたり
translation: (Facade language - Zelgand...)

text: 改ざんを突きて 突き外とやりつた
translation: (Facade language)

text: 祝い事もまた仕事のうちだよ
translation: Celebrations are also part of the job.
grammar: ～のうち means 'part of'; ～もまた means 'also'

text: どうい? / 民につかなまの祭り気分を味わわせてやるのも / 王の思いやりというものだ
translation: What do you mean? / Letting the people enjoy a rare festive mood... / is also the King's kindness.

vocabulary.meaning: to taste, to experience, to enjoy

grammar: ～させてやる is 'to let/allow someone to do (benefactive)'; ～というものだ concludes 'that's what... is'

text: こだった
translation: (Facade language)

text: それにフィアを幸せにできるじゃないか
translation: Besides, you can make Fyra happy.
grammar: ～にできる means 'can make (someone) into'; じゃないか adds encouraging emphasis

text: 大切な誰かを守り幸せにするってことは男には必要なんだ
translation: Protecting someone important and making them happy is necessary for a man.
grammar: ～ってことは means 'the thing about/idea of'; 男には必要 means 'is necessary for a man'

text: アルトレは小さだった / 対決ださ
translation: (Facade language)

text: いいですね結婚試験。
translation: A wedding is nice, isn't it?
grammar: ～ですね seeks agreement

text: お前、人々が祝福をくれる晴れの舞台
translation: Yeah, a grand stage where people give their blessings.

vocabulary.meaning: grand stage, big occasion, day in the spotlight

grammar: 晴れの舞台 is idiom for 'grand occasion/big day'; ～をくれる means 'gives to (speaker/in-group)'

text: 憧れちゃうなぁ / ね、飼い主さん
translation: I admire it... / Right, Kaine?

vocabulary.meaning: to admire, to long for, to yearn for

grammar: ～ちゃう is casual ～てしまう (can't help but); なぁ is drawn out emotional ending; 飼い主さん is Emil's playful nickname for Kaine

text: 知らん / もう
translation: I don't know! / Geez...
grammar: 知らん is casual negative of 知る; もう expresses exasperation

text: イギュンと螺旋地恋 / アルテルはチース養輪地コッテチサイトズセお手に聞く
translation: (Facade language - wedding ceremony)

text: さてるルーター、イチョ
translation: (Facade language)
